intro: Tephrosia carriemichelliae, commonly known as the Carriemichell's tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub with compound leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands.
